label: Load profile
:Definition:: The energy demand

label: Energy timeseries
:Definition:: Timeseries of energy sources from a primary-secondary transformation (e.g. PV, Wind)

label: Source power mix
:Definition:: Percentage of each source of power (inclusive % from Grid)

label: Lower bound renewable energy share
:Definition:: A lower bound on the share of renewable energies in the output energy mix

label: CO2 upper limit
:Definition:: An upper bound on the CO2 emissions

label: Energy source
:Definition:: Energy sources with their capacity open for optimization and technology

label: Storage units
:Definition:: Energy storage units with their capacity and technology
Rational: If the user know already that they are going to use a commercial model

label: Existing energy source infrastructure
:Definition:: Existing energy infrastructure not up for optimization (with given capacities)

label: Existing energy storage infrastructure
:Definition:: Existing storage infrastructure not up for optimization (with given capacities)

label: GPS coordinates
:Definition:: GPS coordinate of the location, to retrieve the weather conditions in case of missing timeseries. Could be a point, a set of points, or a polygon

label: Grid parameters (v2.0 of the tool)
:Definition:: Grid parameters such as:  power, voltage, frequence, line length, line impedance, transformers, topology
Ease of oemof implementation: I'm not sure about this. There are components which represent also the electrical characteristics of the grid (not only energy characteristics) and people are further developing it right now. Not sure, what is already there and what is missing, but I think it's not that difficult to implement more if something is missing, even though we have a lot of experience with grid tools like Dingo and so on...

label: Degree of Autonomy (DA)
:Definition:: Degree of Autonomy or self sufficiency wished, typically a number between 0 and 1

label: Temporal resolution of simulation
:Definition:: Time step of the simulation. The user should be aware that a higher resolution require more data and can lead to longer simulation times
Ease of oemof implementation: time steps are flexible; it's always a matter of data

label: Optimization goal
:Definition:: The quantities which govern the optimization (CO2, costs, renewable maximization in energy mix, degree of autonomy, multi-objectives)
Ease of oemof implementation: optimization goal can be costs or CO2 emissions; maximization in renewable energy or autonomy seems more to be a constraint; multi-objectives are not possible due to linear programming, but users could input weights

label: Maximum investment budget
:Definition:: Upper bound on the investment budget

label: Current price of CO2 emission certificates
:Definition:: Current price of CO2 emission certificates

label: Future price estimates for CO2 emission certificates
:Definition:: Timeseries of future price  for CO2 emission certificates (values from the EU-ETS and DE-ETS)
Rational: The user can load its own timeseries to check their own prediction of CO2 prices

label: Interest rate
:Definition:: A guess of what the  interest rate will be in during the project lifetime. Could be provided as constant or timeseries.

label: Costs of replacement
:Definition:: Costs of replacement/improvement of the current system components/assets
Ease of oemof implementation: not sure, if this exists already, but I think if not it's easy to implement; the mobility team has this in their tools as far as I remember

label: Grid stability fee
:Definition:: Fee/payment for contribution to grid stability

label: Spatial resolution
:Definition:: Define the wished spatial resolution (it is wished that it can range from building up to districts)
Ease of oemof implementation: spatial resolution is flexible; it's always a matter of data

label: New power plant available space
:Definition:: Available space for new power plants (for PV installation for example)
Rational: Space on the rooftop is only for solar, fields can be solar and wind, inside existing building diesel/gas/heat exchanger can be installed but no solar or wind

label: Consumer requirements
:Definition:: consumer requirements such as a specific localisation and wished minimal load profile (e.g. in an industry park)

label: Existing grid structure
:Definition:: GPS coordinates of current grid structure (lines and hubs)
Ease of oemof implementation: in the Ego-Tools I guess, but this is a topic I am not familiar with

label: Future grid structure
:Definition:: GPS coordinates of future grid structure (lines and hubs)
Ease of oemof implementation: in the Ego-Tools I guess, but this is a topic I am not familiar with

label: Security of supply
:Definition:: e.g. existence of back-up system
Ease of oemof implementation: there are many components and constraints for a flexible backup system

label: Balancing ratio for anciliary services
:Definition:: Balancing ratio for ancilliary services (need a more precise definition as PF could not re-figure out what this means)

label: Number of future extra users
:Definition:: Number of future extra user in energy cell

label: Load types
:Definition:: Designation of flexible and non-flexible loads in the load profile

label: Costs of asset use
:Definition:: The price of a liter of diesel or a kWh from the grid
Rational: To be able to compute the cost associated with the use of an asset

label: Project lifetime
:Definition:: The lifetime of the project (simulation time)
